prayers.title: The Sign of the Cross
prayers.content: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

prayers.title: The Apostles' Creed
prayers.content: I believe in God, the Father almighty, Creator of heaven and earth, and in Jesus Christ, His only Son, our Lord, who was conceived by the Holy Spirit, born of the Virgin Mary, suffered under Pontius Pilate, was crucified, died and was buried; He descended into hell; on the third day He rose again from the dead; He ascended into heaven, and is seated at the right hand of God the Father almighty; from there He will come to judge the living and the dead. I believe in the Holy Spirit, the holy catholic Church, the communion of saints, the forgiveness of sins, the resurrection of the body, and life everlasting. Amen.

prayers.title: Our Father (The Lord's Prayer)
prayers.content: Our Father, Who art in heaven, hallowed be Thy name; Thy kingdom come; Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread; and forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us; and lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. Amen.

prayers.title: Hail Mary
prayers.content: Hail Mary, full of grace, the Lord is with thee. Blessed art thou among women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus. Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us sinners, now and at the hour of our death. Amen.

prayers.title: Glory be to the Father
prayers.content: Glory be to the Father, Father, who art in heaven. Amen.

prayers.title: O My Jesus
prayers.content: O my Jesus, forgive us of our sins. Save us from the fires of hell. Lead all souls into heaven, especially those in most need of thy mercy. Amen.

prayers.title: Hail Holy Queen
prayers.content: Hail Holy Queen, Mother of Mercy, our Life, our Sweetness, and our hope. To thee do we cry, poor banished children of Eve. To thee do we send up our sighs, mourning and weeping in this vale of tears. Turn then most gracious advocate, Thine eyes of mercy toward us, and after this, our exile, show unto us, the blessed fruit of thy womb, Jesus. O clement, O loving, O sweet Virgin Mary. Pray for us O Holy Mother of God, That we may be made worthy of the promises of Christ. Amen.

mysteries.title: The Annunciation
mysteries.caption: First Joyful Mystery
mysteries.description:
And when the angel had come to her, he said, 'Hail, full of grace, the Lord is with thee. Blessed art thou among women.' 
(Luke 1:28)

mysteries.title: The Visitation
mysteries.caption: Second Joyful Mystery
mysteries.description:
Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit and cried out in a loud voice: 'Blest are you among women and blest is the fruit of your womb.' 
(Luke 1:41-42)

mysteries.title: The Nativity
mysteries.caption: Third Joyful Mystery
mysteries.description:
She gave birth to her first-born Son and wrapped Him in swaddling clothes and laid Him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the place where travelers lodged. 
(Luke 2:7)

mysteries.title: The Presentation
mysteries.caption: Fourth Joyful Mystery
mysteries.description:
When the day came to purify them according to the law of Moses, the couple brought Him up to Jerusalem so that He could be presented to the Lord, for it is written in the law of the Lord, 'Every first-born male shall be consecrated to the Lord.' 
(Luke 2:22-23)

mysteries.title: The Finding in the Temple
mysteries.caption: Fifth Joyful Mystery
mysteries.description:
On the third day they came upon Him in the temple sitting in the midst of the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
(Luke 2:46)

mysteries.title: Baptism of Jesus
mysteries.caption: First Luminous Mystery
mysteries.description:
And when Jesus was baptized, … the heavens were opened and He saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove, and alighting on Him, and lo, a voice from heaven, saying 'this is My beloved Son,' with whom I am well pleased.' 
(Matthew 3:16-17)

mysteries.title: Wedding at Cana
mysteries.caption: Second Luminous Mystery
mysteries.description:
His mother said to the servants, 'Do whatever He tells you.' … Jesus said to them, 'Fill the jars with water.' And they filled them up to the brim.
(John 2:5-7)

mysteries.title: Proclaiming the Kingdom
mysteries.caption: Third Luminous Mystery
mysteries.description:
And preach as you go, saying, 'The kingdom of heaven is at hand.' Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse lepers, cast out demons. You received without pay, give without pay. 
(Matthew 10:7-8)

mysteries.title: Transfiguration
mysteries.caption: Fourth Luminous Mystery
mysteries.description:
And as He was praying, the appearance of His countenance was altered and His raiment become dazzling white. And a voice came out of the cloud saying, 'This is My Son, My chosen; listen to Him!' 
(Luke 9:29, 35)

mysteries.title: Institution of the Eucharist
mysteries.caption: Fifth Luminous Mystery
mysteries.description:
And He took bread, and when He had given thanks He broke it and gave it to them, saying, 'This is My body which is given for you.' … And likewise the cup after supper, saying, 'This cup which is poured out for you is the new covenant in My blood.' 
(Luke 22:19-20)

mysteries.title: The Agony in the Garden
mysteries.caption: First Sorrowful Mystery
mysteries.description:
In His anguish He prayed with all the greater intensity, and His sweat became like drops of blood falling to the ground. Then He rose from prayer and came to His disciples, only to find them asleep, exhausted with grief.
(Luke 22:44-45)

mysteries.title: The Scourging at the Pillar
mysteries.caption: Second Sorrowful Mystery
mysteries.description:
Pilate’s next move was to take Jesus and have Him scourged.
(John 19:1)

mysteries.title: The Crowning with Thorns
mysteries.caption: Third Sorrowful Mystery
mysteries.description:
They stripped off His clothes and wrapped Him in a scarlet military cloak. Weaving a crown out of thorns they fixed it on His head, and stuck a reed in His right hand …
(Matthew 27:28-29)

mysteries.title: The Carrying of the Cross
mysteries.caption: Fourth Sorrowful Mystery
mysteries.description:
… carrying the cross by Himself, He went out to what is called the Place of the Skull (in Hebrew, Golgotha)
(John 19:17)

mysteries.title: The Crucifixion
mysteries.caption: Fifth Sorrowful Mystery
mysteries.description:
Jesus uttered a loud cry and said, 'Father, into Your hands I commend My spirit.' After He said this, He expired.
(Luke 23:46)

mysteries.title: The Resurrection
mysteries.caption: First Glorious Mystery
mysteries.description:
You need not be amazed! You are looking for Jesus of Nazareth, the one who was crucified. He has been raised up; He is not here. See the place where they laid Him.
(Mark 16:6)

mysteries.title: The Ascension
mysteries.caption: Second Glorious Mystery
mysteries.description:
Then, after speaking to them, the Lord Jesus was taken up into Heaven and took His seat at God’s right hand.
(Mark 16:19)

mysteries.title: The Descent of the Holy Spirit
mysteries.caption: Third Glorious Mystery
mysteries.description:
All were filled with the Holy Spirit. They began to express themselves in foreign tongues and make bold proclamation as the Spirit prompted them.
(Acts 2:4)

mysteries.title: The Assumption of Mary
mysteries.caption: Fourth Glorious Mystery
mysteries.description:
You are the glory of Jerusalem … you are the splendid boast of our people … God is pleased with what you have wrought. May you be blessed by the Lord Almighty forever and ever.
(Judith 15:9-10)

mysteries.title: The Coronation of Mary
mysteries.caption: Fifth Glorious Mystery
mysteries.description:
A great sign appeared in the sky, a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars.
(Revelation 12:1)
